Pronunciation: "A . j A m _ b u . "A _ k @ . l u . "A k
Definition: A popular Peranakan dish that consists of chicken cooked with the nut of the kepayang tree (Pangium edule), which is known as buah keluak in Malay. The nut is soaked, pounded, and sometimes mixed with spices to make a thick paste that is used to flavor the dish. It is commonly served with rice. Note: In Singapore and Malaysia, "ayam" refers to chicken, and "buah keluak" may also be spelled as "buah keluwek" or "keluwak".
